Posts.Content: Twodigit67 wrote: Scared and uninsured here and need a shoulder from someone that understands. My daughter had premature twins 9 weeks ago and I stayed at the Ronald McDonald house with her while they were in the hospital (almost 4 wks). When my daughter would pump for the babies I would distract her other children by reading to them (one laying her head on my chest). After about 2 weeks my left breast just all of a sudden got very swollen and painful with red streaks. I thought somehow I was having some kind of sympathy for my daughter or been around too many breast feeding mothers and had somehow got mastitis. So I looked up home remedies and put cabbage in my bra for 4 days 'and it helped', the pain went away. Two weeks later I found a lump in my right breast just under skin in the areole. Though the lump does not hurt, I sometimes get very sharp stinging pains in both breast. The pain does not last long, but is definately painful enough to make me stop whatever I am doing till it passes. First symptom 7 weeks now, stinging and lump about 5 weeks. About 2 weeks ago my daughter told me she had a lump too. Hers is located in similar area to mine and a little smaller, but she has had no pain at all. Since she has insurance plus since pregnancy has temp medicaid to supplement it, I told her to go to the dr and if they said it was nothing I would get a little peace of mind about mine too. Well she went to dr today. She called me in tears upon leaving the dr and said that the dr asked her if she had any pain, when she replied no she was told that she needed to go to her ob/gyn and get another exam and probably a mammogram and that this dr was concerned. I never ever ever want either of my 2 daughters have cancer of any kind or for that matter, I never want them to be sick in any form. That being said now my daughter is mad at me. When she called me the first words she said was "Well you should be fine because you have pain, but the dr is worried about me". After 5 wks of my daughter saying Mom I'm sure it's nothing probably a clogged duct and dismissing my fears of course now I am really scared. I'm scared for her and myself. Unfortunately I tried to explain my symptoms to her and she just dismissed me again. And now she refuses to even talked to me, because I told her at least she has insurance and can get help. My husband and I make just enough money to get by, but not enough to provide me with his company insurance. And now it seems everyone I call for help tells me we make about $100 or so a month to much to get help. Where do I go from here? Right now I just want to sit in my house and say I quit and not even try to fight this battle. New here and trying to figure out where to post so bare with me please.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Uninsured Not Diagnosed but Scared Twodigit67 Moderators

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2012 12:36AM Twodigit67 wrote: Thank you Chrissy, making me cry lol.
Posts.Title: Uninsured Not Diagnosed but Scared Twodigit67 Moderators

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2012 01:15AM Twodigit67 wrote: My daughter doesn't think I should even be on here, because she is determined my body is reacting sypathedically to her.  She thinks it can't be cancer and that by me talking to others on here and seeing that others have to exact same story as mine and are diagnosed with BC it makes me think the worse.  I tried to tell her I would rather be prepared for the worse and celebrate good results than think it's nothing and be devastated by back results.  I have been told to stay off the computer!!!
Posts.Title: Uninsured Not Diagnosed but Scared Twodigit67 Moderators

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2012 10:29AM Twodigit67 wrote: Have my exam and hopefully mammogram next Friday Oct 5th, hoping for the best trying to prepare for the worse. Will keep everyone updated.  And thank you all so much for your support.  And I live in Oklahoma where uninsured health care sucks, but they are seeing me through the Take Charge program for now.  At least until our income goes over by $100 which will be next month, not sure after that.
Posts.Title: Uninsured Not Diagnosed but Scared Twodigit67 Moderators

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2012 03:17AM Twodigit67 wrote: There are places for low income but we are right on the edge to qualify.  Life has been tough the last 3 yrs for our family.  My husband both my daughters and my future son in law all worked as corrections officers at a CCA prison near by, my husband had 10 yrs in and was a Captain and training officer when the prison closed and almost the entire family got laid off at once.  So it has just been tough, but we have survived so far.  I really wish I could have found this out 3 yrs ago when I had insurance though.
Posts.Title: Uninsured Not Diagnosed but Scared Twodigit67 Moderators

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2012 01:07AM Twodigit67 wrote: CPJennings I appreciate your story, it sounds so much like what is happening with me, someone I can relate to.  Four years ago I had a hysterectomy and my dr told me I was ate up with fibroids, he said I had so many they had displace my other organs and that everywhere he cut, he cut one of them.  He also told me that they would send some for cancer testing but not all of them.  Also since losing my insurance coverage I have not been able to get my nexium to control my acid reflux nor go in to have my scopes done on my esophagus like the dr wants so that has gotten really bad now.  So from all of my history it is really not a big leap to what is happening now.  And I discovered this morning that the discharge from my breast which I have had since having my first daughter 28 yrs ago is now blood, whereas before it was like colostrum.   Is it just me or does everyone just automatically jump to the worse possible scenario.  I try to tell myself prepare for the worse, hope for the best. But honestly I have known every time something was wrong with me even if I didn't know what it was.  Like with my hysterectomy I knew something was wrong for over 2 years and I tried to tell my family I didn't know what was wrong, but THERE WAS SOMETHING WRONG, I also think maybe I have a little denial going on, because I feel like I'm almost OK with this.  Not that I want this to be happening, but that if it is happening I'm OK.  I even laughed and told my husband he may end up with a skinny wife again, bald maybe but skinny.  And if it takes this happening to me to catch the same thing in my daughters early enough for them to be successfully treated than that is all I ask.
Posts.Title: Uninsured Not Diagnosed but Scared Twodigit67 Moderators

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2012 07:40AM Twodigit67 wrote: Thank you all. They are trying to get me signed up for OK Cares, which provides medicaid throughout treatment. Hopefully I get it.  Just thinking going enjoy my last few days of denial before the path report comes back.  Last night after biopsy was miserable, so I know this isn't going to be a picnic.  Granddaughter's 4th birthday party tomorrow Grammy usually does all the birthday cakes for them, but had to order one today, that sucked.
Posts.Title: Uninsured Not Diagnosed but Scared Twodigit67 Moderators

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2012 11:45AM Twodigit67 wrote: Well here's my update:  Breast exam, diagnostic mammogram, ultrasound and biopsy all in the same day,  Have to wait till Wednesday for a definite diagnosis, buttttttttttttt!!!!!  Good news is Dr said I did great in finding it early and that it is small, bad news is she thinks it is cancer.  Wow what a day I had!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Uninsured Not Diagnosed but Scared Twodigit67 Moderators
